data.title: Honor Roll of Contributors
data.text:
Thank You!

The Virginia Museum of Fine Arts is grateful to the dedicated supporters—members, donors, community partners, corporations, and foundations—whose gifts of time and talent make it possible for us to share the spark of art with all Virginians. We thank the Commonwealth of Virginia, our Board of Trustees and Board of Directors, and all those listed below for their investment in VMFA.

The 2021-2022 Honor Roll of Contributors, prepared by the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts, represents contributions and pledges received between July 1, 2021 and June 30, 2022. VMFA recognizes multiyear gifts and pledges for their full amounts in the fiscal year they are made. Subsequent payments are recognized for their cash values.

CUMULATIVE GIVING

From annual membership gifts to designated funding for exhibitions, educational initiatives, conservation, art purchases, and capital improvements, support for VMFA takes many forms. We gratefully acknowledge the total giving of the following individuals and institutions who made gifts and pledges of $500 or more during the last fiscal year.

BELVEDERE SOCIETY

Overlooking the museum’s entire campus, the belvedere in the E. Claiborne and Lora Robins Sculpture Garden truly provides a “beautiful view.” This vantage point is a fitting moniker for a group of patrons whose extraordinary generosity has enabled every aspect of the museum to flourish. Established in 2021, the Belvedere Society recognizes those who have made gifts of one million dollars or more over the course of a lifetime.

GLASGOW SOCIETY

VMFA recognizes all those who make a planned gift to the museum with membership in the Glasgow Society, formerly the Heritage Society. Legacy gifts may provide unrestricted support for the museum’s greatest needs or be directed toward special projects that reflect a donor’s passion. For their commitment to VMFA’s future, we gratefully acknowledge the newest Glasgow Society members and those who made additional gifts this year.

NEW ENDOWMENTS

A strong endowment is the very core of the museum’s financial foundation. While most philanthropic gifts support immediate needs, endowed funds provide an ongoing source of income to ensure VMFA’s financial stability well into the future. We are grateful for these newly created funds whose annual income will support a variety of critical needs across the museum.
